intro: Wigginsia sessiliflora subsp. tetracantha, commonly known as the four-armed wigginsia, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring four distinct, spiny branches that emerge from the base. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are usually small,革质 (leathery), and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural environment.
